TITLE: Installing Goat CLI Tool
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for installing the goat CLI tool using Go toolchain or manual installation method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/goat/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
go install github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/cmd/goat@latest
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo
go build ./cmd/goat
sudo cp goat /usr/local/bin
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Feed Data Structures in Go
DESCRIPTION: Defines the core data structures for representing social media feeds with optimization for data deduplication and flexible information retrieval. The structure allows for efficient storage of feed items, their associated records, and metadata about posts and actors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/docs/feed-proposal.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
type Feed struct {
  Items []FeedItem
  Values map[Cid]Record
  ItemInfos map[Uri]ItemInfo
  ActorInfos map[Did]ActorInfo
}

type FeedItem struct {
  Uri string
  Replies []Uri
  ReplyTo Uri
  RepostedBy Did
}

type ItemInfo struct {
  Cid Cid
  Upvotes int
  Reposts int
  Replies int
  Author Did
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Rule Function Types in Golang
DESCRIPTION: Core type definitions for different kinds of moderation rule functions, including identity, record, post, and profile rules. Each type receives a context parameter and handles different aspects of content moderation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/automod/HOWTO_write_rules.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: golang
CODE:
```
type IdentityRuleFunc = func(c *AccountContext) error
type RecordRuleFunc = func(c *RecordContext) error
type PostRuleFunc = func(c *RecordContext, post *appbsky.FeedPost) error
type ProfileRuleFunc = func(c *RecordContext, profile *appbsky.ActorProfile) error
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Palomar Search Functionality via CLI
DESCRIPTION: Commands to test Palomar's search functionality for posts and profiles from the command line, including a typeahead example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/palomar/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
go run ./cmd/palomar search-post "hello"
go run ./cmd/palomar search-profile "hello"
go run ./cmd/palomar search-profile -typeahead "h"

For more commands and args:

go run ./cmd/palomar --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SQLite Schema and Queries for Block Storage
DESCRIPTION: SQL schema and operations for SQLiteStore implementation. Includes table creation with indexes, and essential queries for inserting, selecting, and deleting blocks. The schema stores user blocks with CID, revision, root, and block data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/carstore/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS blocks (uid int, cid blob, rev varchar, root blob, block blob, PRIMARY KEY(uid,cid))
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS blocx_by_rev ON blocks (uid, rev DESC)

INSERT INTO blocks (uid, cid, rev, root, block) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?) ON CONFLICT (uid,cid) DO UPDATE SET rev=excluded.rev, root=excluded.root, block=excluded.block

SELECT rev, root FROM blocks WHERE uid = ? ORDER BY rev DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT cid,rev,root,block FROM blocks WHERE uid = ? AND rev > ? ORDER BY rev DESC

DELETE FROM blocks WHERE uid = ?

SELECT rev, root FROM blocks WHERE uid = ? AND cid = ? LIMIT 1

SELECT block FROM blocks WHERE uid = ? AND cid = ? LIMIT 1

SELECT length(block) FROM blocks WHERE uid = ? AND cid = ? LIMIT 1
```

TITLE: PLC Operations
DESCRIPTION: Commands for working with PLC records including history viewing, snapshot creation, and monitoring.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/goat/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ goat plc history atproto.com
[...]

$ goat plc dump | pv -l | gzip > plc_snapshot.json.gz
[...]

$ goat plc dump --cursor now --tail
[...]
```

TITLE: Full-Text Search Query
DESCRIPTION: Example of a full-text query string search with field boosting and various search parameters

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:

  "query": {
    "query_string": {
      "query": "blood",
      "analyzer": "textIcuSearch",
      "default_operator": "AND",
      "analyze_wildcard": true,
      "lenient": true,
      "fields": ["handle^5", "text"]
    }
  },
  "size": 3
}
```

TITLE: Firehose Stream Processing
DESCRIPTION: Commands for subscribing to and processing the repo commit stream from a Relay.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/goat/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

$ goat firehose --account-events | jq .payload.handle
[...]

# text of posts (empty lines for post-deletions)
$ goat firehose - app.bsky.feed.post --ops | jq .record.text
[...]

# sample ratio of languages in current posts
$ goat firehose --ops -c app.bsky.feed.post | head -n100 | jq .record.langs[0] -c | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr
     51 "en"
     33 "ja"
      7 null
      3 "pt"
      2 "ko"
      1 "th"
      1 "id"
      1 "es"
      1 "am"
```

TITLE: Structuring Access Token JWT for Bluesky Social Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Defines the JSON Web Token (JWT) structure for the access token used in Bluesky Social authentication. It includes the scope, subject (user's DID), issued at time, and expiration time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/docs/auth.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
"scope": "com.atproto.access",
"sub": "<the users DID>",
"iat": "the current time, in unix epoch seconds",
"exp": "the expiry date, usually around an hour, but at least 15 minutes"
}
```

TITLE: Running OpenSearch with Docker for Palomar Development
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build and run an ephemeral OpenSearch instance for local development with SSL disabled and required plugins installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/palomar/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker build -f Dockerfile.opensearch . -t opensearch-palomar

# in any non-development system, obviously change this default password
docker run -p 9200:9200 -p 9600:9600 -e "discovery.type=single-node" -e "plugins.security.disabled=true" -e OPENSEARCH_INITIAL_ADMIN_PASSWORD=0penSearch-Pal0mar opensearch-palomar
```

TITLE: Structuring Refresh Token JWT for Bluesky Social Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Defines the JSON Web Token (JWT) structure for the refresh token used in Bluesky Social authentication. It includes the scope, subject (user's DID), issued at time, expiration time, and a unique identifier for the token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/docs/auth.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
"scope": "com.atproto.refresh",
"sub": "<the users DID>",
"iat": "the current time, in unix epoch seconds",
"exp": "the expiry date, usually around a week, must be significantly longer than the access token",
"jti": "a unique identifier for this token"
}
```

TITLE: Implementing GTUBE Spam Detection Rule in Go for Bluesky Social Posts
DESCRIPTION: This function implements a simple spam detection rule for Bluesky Social posts. It checks if the post text contains the GTUBE (Generic Test for Unsolicited Bulk Email) string, which is commonly used for testing spam filters. If found, the post is labeled as spam.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/automod/HOWTO_write_rules.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: golang
CODE:
```
// the GTUBE string is a special value historically used to test email spam filtering behavior
var gtubeString = "XJS*C4JDBQADN1.NSBN3*2IDNEN*GTUBE-STANDARD-ANTI-UBE-TEST-EMAIL*C.34X"

func GtubePostRule(c *automod.RecordContext, post *appbsky.FeedPost) error {
	if strings.Contains(post.Text, gtubeString) {
		c.AddRecordLabel("spam")
	}
	return nil
}
```

TITLE: Administrative API Request Examples
DESCRIPTION: Curl commands demonstrating how to interact with the relay's admin API endpoints using authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/bigsky/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
RELAY_ADMIN_PASSWORD=$(openssl rand --hex 16)
bigsky  --api-listen :2470 --admin-key ${RELAY_ADMIN_PASSWORD} ...

curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer '${RELAY_ADMIN_PASSWORD} -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' --data '' http://127.0.0.1:2470/admin/repo/compactAll
```

TITLE: Configuring Caddy Server for Reverse Proxy and SSL
DESCRIPTION: Caddyfile configuration for setting up a reverse proxy to the Astrolabe server with automatic SSL certificate management using Let's Encrypt. This setup enables HTTPS access to the Astrolabe server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/astrolabe/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: caddyfile
CODE:
```

  on_demand_tls {
    interval 1h
    burst 8
  }
}

:443 {
  reverse_proxy localhost:8400
  tls YOUREMAIL@example.com {
    on_demand
  }
}
```

TITLE: Nginx Configuration for Proxying to Athome
DESCRIPTION: Nginx configuration snippet that demonstrates how to proxy requests from the /bsky path to an athome service while preserving headers for proper forwarding.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/athome/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
location /bsky {
    // in theory https:// should work, on default port?
    proxy_pass      http://athome.example.com:8200;
    proxy_set_header    X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header    Host      $http_host;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto https;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
}
```

TITLE: Running Fakermaker Commands in Indigo
DESCRIPTION: A series of shell commands to run various fakermaker operations, including generating accounts, profiles, follow graphs, posts, interactions, and browsing simulations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/fakermaker/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mkdir -p data/fakermaker
export GOLOG_LOG_LEVEL=info

# setup and create initial accounts; 100 by default
# supply --use-invite-code and/or --domain-suffix SUFFIX as needed
go run ./cmd/fakermaker/ gen-accounts > data/fakermaker/accounts.json

# create or update profiles for all the accounts
go run ./cmd/fakermaker/ gen-profiles

# create follow graph between accounts
go run ./cmd/fakermaker/ gen-graph

# create posts, including mentions and image uploads
go run ./cmd/fakermaker/ gen-posts

# create more interactions, such as likes, between accounts
go run ./cmd/fakermaker/ gen-interactions

# lastly, read-only queries, including timelines, notifications, and post threads
go run ./cmd/fakermaker/ run-browsing
```

TITLE: Configuring Crawler Rules in robots.txt for Bluesky Social Indigo
DESCRIPTION: Standard robots.txt configuration that allows all user agents to crawl the entire domain with a note about rate limiting through HTTP 429 status codes. It also suggests using the atproto.com API for bulk or automated crawling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/blob/main/cmd/athome/static/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
# Hello Friends!
# If you are considering bulk or automated crawling, you may want to look in
# to our protocol (API), including a firehose of updates. See: https://atproto.com/

# By default, may crawl anything on this domain. HTTP 429 ("backoff") status
# codes are used for rate-limiting. Up to a handful concurrent requests should
# be ok.
User-Agent: *
Allow: /
```
